required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate a Contact Lens Lubricating and Rewetting Drop
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Evaluate the Product Feasibility of a Contact Lens Lubricating and Rewetting Drop

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the product performance of investigational lubricating and rewetting drops.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Graded Slit Lamp Findings Greater Than Grade 2.
primary_outcome.description: Slit lamp findings for epithelial edema, epithelial microcysts, corneal staining, limbal injection, bulbar injection, upper lid tarsal conjunctival abnormalities, corneal neovascularization, and corneal infiltrates were graded 0 to 4, with 0 = none to 4 = severe. The outcome measure is any finding > grade 2, across abnormalities.

arm_group.description: Lubricating and Rewetting Drops, after one week of using the first rewetting drops, the subjects will return for an exam and crossover to the second rewetting drops for one week.

arm_group.arm_group_label: AMO Blink Contacts Lubricant Eye Drops
arm_group.description: AMO Blink Contacts Lubricant Eye Drops, After one week of using the first rewetting drops, the subjects will return for an exam and crossover to the second rewetting drops for one week

intervention.description: Instill 1-2 rewetting drops in each eye at least QID (4 times per day) for one week.

intervention.intervention_name: AMO Blink Contacts Lubricant Eye Drops
intervention.description: Instill 1-2 rewetting drops in each eye at least QID (4 times per day) for one week.
intervention.arm_group_label: AMO Blink Contacts Lubricant Eye Drops

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have physiologically normal anterior segments not exhibiting clinically significant biomicroscopy findings.
- Adapted wearers of soft contact lenses, wear a lens in each eye, and each lens must be of the same manufacture and brand.
- Use a lens care system on a regular basis.
- Wear their habitual lenses (or be willing to wear lenses) a minimum of 8 hours per day.
- Willing to use drops 4 times per day.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participating in a conflicting study.
- An active ocular disease, any corneal infiltrative response, or are using any ocular medications.
- Any scar or neovascularization within the central 4mm of the cornea.
- Any grade 2 or greater finding during the slit lamp examination
- Using any systemic or topical medications that will affect ocular physiology or lens performance.
- Aphakic.
- Amblyopic.
- Allergic to any component in the study care products.
- Have had any corneal surgery.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: There were 168 participants enrolled and 166 participants treated. The study was a cross-over study, so the 166 participants received both treatment groups.

Lubricating and Rewetting Drops, after one week of using the first rewetting drops, the subjects will return for an exam and crossover to the second rewetting drops for one week. Lubricating and Rewetting Drops: Instill 1-2 rewetting drops in each eye at least QID (4 times per day) for one week.

baseline.population: Treated participants were included in the analysis population.

group.title: Overall
group.description: The study was a cross-over study, so the 166 treated participants received both treatment groups.

outcome.title: Percentage of Eyes With Graded Slit Lamp Findings Greater Than Grade 2.
outcome.description: Slit lamp findings for epithelial edema, epithelial microcysts, corneal staining, limbal injection, bulbar injection, upper lid tarsal conjunctival abnormalities, corneal neovascularization, and corneal infiltrates were graded 0 to 4, with 0 = none to 4 = severe. The outcome measure is any finding > grade 2, across abnormalities.
outcome.population: There were 330 eyes evaluable for slit lamp findings in each group.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events were not coded. Therefore source vocabulary is not applicable.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
